title: The Charming Quirks of Others
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: 'Leslie Place. It's that narrow street that goes up to St Bernard's Crescent.'

title: The Charming Quirks of Others
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: She walked down  Leslie Place, looking up  at the  numbers painted on the stone above the doors. With one or two exceptions, the doors here led to what were called common stairs – a stone stairway shared by a number of flats that gave off each landing  of  the  four-storey  tenement.

title: The Charming Quirks of Others
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: I walked with her down St Stephen Street. She lives in Leslie Place, just over the bridge, and she asked me whether I would  come back with  her to  her flat. She said that she needed to talk to somebody and there was nobody in the flat.
